document.docAuthor: Nurinsiyah, Ayu Savitri, Neiber, Marco T. & Hausdorf, Bernhard
document.docTitle: Landouria menorehensis Nurinsiyah & Neiber & Hausdorf 2019, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the land snail genus Landouria Godwin-Austen, 1918 (Gastropoda, Camaenidae) from Java

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the land snail genus Landouria Godwin-Austen, 1918 (Gastropoda, Camaenidae) from Java

subSubSection.paragraph:
Landouria menorehensis
sp. nov. is characterized by a whitish, globose shell with a distinct brown band above the rounded periphery and a moderately narrow umbilicus.

Landouria menorehensis
sp. nov. is named after its occurrence in the Menoreh karst area.

INDONESIA –

GENITALIA ( Figs 47 , 71 ; Table 4 ). Atrium short; penis short, distal part cylindrical, proximal part slightly dilated, without penis coecum; membranaceous sheath around penis connected with proximal part of epiphallus by tissue; penial retractor runs from diaphragm to distal part of short epiphallus; flagellum long, broadest in its middle part, almost smooth, without node, tapering towards its proximal end; vas deferens narrow and long; vagina long; oviduct short; peduncle of bursa copulatrix subdivided into a short, broad distal part and a narrow and long proximal part, ending in an elongate oval bursa beside albumen gland. Right ommatophoral retractor runs between penis and vagina.

Landouria menorehensis
sp. nov. shares with
L. pakidulan
sp. nov. and
L. ciliocincta
the whitish shell with a brown band at the periphery. For differences, see remarks under
L. pakidulan
sp. nov.

Landouria menorehensis
sp. nov. is endemic to the Menoreh karst area ( Fig. 55) .
